required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating The Antitumor Activity Of MEDI-522 With Or Without Dacarbazine In Patients With Metastatic Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomized, Open-Label Study Evaluating The Antitumor Activity Of MEDI-522, A Humanized Monoclonal Antibody Directed Against The Human Alpha V Beta 3 Integrin, ± Dacarbazine In Patients With Metastatic Melanoma

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objectives of this study are:
- To explore the antitumor activity of MEDI-522 ± DTIC in patients with metastatic melanoma.
- To determine the safety of MEDI-522 ± DTIC in this patient population.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Phase II, randomized, open-label, two-arm, multicenter study of MEDI 522 ± DTIC in previously untreated (other than adjuvant immunotherapy) patients with Stage IV metastatic melanoma (AJCC staging).

primary_outcome.measure: Explore antitumor activity of MEDI-522 in patients with metastatic melanoma.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Screening and after every 2 cycles of treatment until disease progression. At least 4 weeks after a patient demonstrates response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determine the safety of MEDI-522 and/or DTIC in this patient population.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every week until disease progression, and 30 days after disease progression.

intervention.description: IV administration supplied in 10 mL vials containing 100 mg of MEDI-522 at a concentration of 10 mg/mL.

facility.name: Winship Cancer Institute of Emory University
Johns Hopkins University - SKCC at Johns Hopkins
The Melanoma Center of St. Louis
The University of Texas, MD Anderson Cancer Center

responsible_party.name_title: Luz Hammershaimb, M.D., V.P., Clinical Dev.
